item.title: Use regex mode to efficiently find and replace in a specific folder with Atom
item.description: One specific feature of Atom I like is the “find and replace” for a specific folder (ctrl+shift+F by default on Debian). It could be extremely powerful when the regex mode is on. Let me give you an example. Yesterday I had to replace all \code{sometext} with 'sometext' which represented dozens of matches in several files. Well, it was not hard at all!
